ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Are you going to bed or waking up?
Notes: 0 = Going to bed; 1 = Just woke up; 2 = Pulled all-nighter/no sleep; 3 = Forgot bedtime diary; 4 = Forgot morning diary

ElementDescription: Did you take the wrist device off today?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Did you take the wrist device off yesterday?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: If yes, what time did you take the wrist device off today?
Notes: HH:MM AM/PM

ElementDescription: How long was it off (minutes)?
Why did you take it off?
Did you take any naps today?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Did you take any naps yesterday?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: If yes, what time did your nap begin?
Notes: HH:MM AM/PM

ElementDescription: What time did your nap end?
Notes: HH:MM AM/PM

ElementDescription: Did you take more than one nap?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: If yes, what time did your second nap begin?
Notes: HH:MM AM/PM

ElementDescription: What time did your second nap end?
Notes: HH:MM AM/PM

ElementDescription: How did you feel today?
Notes: 1 = Extremely sleepy, fighting sleep; 9 = Extremely alert

ElementDescription: How stressed were you today?
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 5 = Extremely

ElementDescription: Did you accomplish what you set out to do today?
Notes: 1 = No, none of it; 3 = Yes, all of it

ElementDescription: Did you accomplish what you set out to do yesterday?
Notes: 1 = No, none of it; 3 = Yes, all of it

ElementDescription: Tonight, I got into bed at...
Notes: HH:MM AM/PM

ElementDescription: Today, I woke up at...
Notes: HH:MM AM/PM

ElementDescription: How long do you think it took you to fall asleep last night (minutes)
How many times did you wake up last night? (put 0 if you didn't wake up)
How many minutes were you awake in total?
How would you rate your sleep quality overall last night?
Notes: 1 = Very good; 4 = Very bad

ElementDescription: Did you consume or use any of the following yesterday? Caffeine
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Did you consume or use any of the following yesterday? Alcohol
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Did you consume or use any of the following yesterday? Marijuana
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: If yes for caffeiene, what time did you last consume caffeine yesterday?
Notes: HH:MM AM/PM

ElementDescription: If yes for alcohol, what time did you last consume alcohol yesterday?
Notes: HH:MM AM/PM

ElementDescription: If yes for marijuana, what time did you last consume marijuana/THC yesterday?
Notes: HH:MM AM/PM

ElementDescription: Enter the number of servings for each beverage you consumed yesterday (leave blank if 0)
How many servings of alcohol did you have yesterday?
Did you consume alcohol with caffeine (either as a mixed drink or at the same time)?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: How many combined alcohol/caffeine drinks did you consume?
Did you consume alcohol and marijuana/THC so that the effects overlapped?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: How did you feel after drinking? If you did not feel any effcts of alcohol, report 0 on the scale.
Notes: 0 = Slightly buzzed; 100 = Wasted

ElementDescription: Did your alcohol use cause a hangover?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Did your alcohol use cause a blackout?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Rate how positive or negative your experiences in academics were over the past 24 hours:
Notes: -3 = Very negative; 3 = Very positive

ElementDescription: Rate how positive or negative your experiences in emotion were over the past 24 hours:
Notes: -3 = Very negative; 3 = Very positive

ElementDescription: Rate how positive or negative your experiences in interpersonal life were over the past 24 hours:
Notes: -3 = Very negative; 3 = Very positive

ElementDescription: Rate how positive or negative your experiences in physical health were over the past 24 hours:
Notes: -3 = Very negative; 3 = Very positive

ElementDescription: Overall, which of the following best reflects your experience of the past 24 hours?
Notes: 1 = The good outweighed the bad; 3 = The bad outweighed the good

ElementDescription: How much do you need to accomplish today?
Notes: 1 = Very little; 3 = A lot

ElementDescription: I got out of bed/ started my day at...
Notes: HH:MM AM/PM

ElementDescription: Tuesday Night-Wednesday Morning time slept
Notes: Time participant went to bed to the time participant woke up, if woke up and went back to sleep multiple times separate with commas

ElementDescription: Tuesday Night-Wednesday Morning hours slept
Notes: Total number of hours participant slept

ElementDescription: Wednesday Night-Thursday Morning date
Notes: MM/DD/YYYY Dates of Wednesday Night-Thursday Morning sleep

ElementDescription: Wednesday Night-Thursday Morning time slept
Notes: Time participant went to bed to the time participant woke up, if woke up and went back to sleep multiple times separate with commas

ElementDescription: Wednesday Night-Thursday Morning hours slept
Notes: Total number of hours participant slept

Notes: MM/DD/YYYY Dates of Thursday Night-Friday Morning sleep

Notes: Time participant went to bed to the time participant woke up, if woke up and went back to sleep multiple times separate with commas

ElementDescription: Thursday Night-Friday Morning hours slept
Notes: Total number of hours participant slept

Notes: MM/DD/YYYY Dates of Friday Night-Saturday Morning sleep

Notes: Time participant went to bed to the time participant woke up, if woke up and went back to sleep multiple times separate with commas

Notes: MM/DD/YYYY Dates of Saturday Night-Sunday Morning sleep

Notes: Time participant went to bed to the time participant woke up, if woke up and went back to sleep multiple times separate with commas

ElementDescription: Saturday Night-Sunday Morning hours slept
Notes: Total number of hours participant slept

Notes: Include all listed separated by commas

Notes: Include all listed separated by commas

Notes: Include all listed separated by commas

ElementDescription: Day of week and time participant awoke using an alarm
Notes: Include all listed separated by commas

Notes: Include all listed separated by commas

ElementDescription: Day of week and time participant ate a meal or had a snack
Notes: Include all listed separated by commas

Notes: MM/DD/YYYY Dates of Sunday Night-Monday Morning sleep

Notes: Include all listed separated by commas

ElementDescription: Day of week and time participant took prescription medications
Notes: Include all listed separated by commas

ElementDescription: Day of week and time participant took off the actigraph watch
Notes: Include all listed separated by commas

ElementDescription: Sunday Night-Monday Morning time slept
Notes: Time participant went to bed to the time participant woke up, if woke up and went back to sleep multiple times separate with commas

Notes: Total number of hours participant slept

Notes: MM/DD/YYYY Dates of Monday Night-Tuesday Morning sleep

Notes: Time participant went to bed to the time participant woke up, if woke up and went back to sleep multiple times separate with commas
